data.profileText: A Representative from North Carolina; born near Norfolk, Va., in 1784; moved to Chapel Hill, N.C.; was tutored at home; attended the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill 1802-1804; studied law; admitted to the bar and commenced practice in Salisbury, N.C., in 1806; elected as a Democratic Republican to the Fourteenth Congress (March 4, 1815-March 3, 1817); resumed the practice of law in Salisbury, Rowan County, N.C., where he died on December 3, 1824; interment in a private cemetery in Salisbury.
